units.title: Establish organoid system with CRISPR perturbations
units.text: To establish an organoid system that enables CRISPR perturbations with single-cell transcriptomic readout, we used a human embryonic stem cell (hES cell) line expressing an enhanced specificity SpCas9 (eCas9), which has substantially reduced off-target effects and is controlled by an upstream loxp stop element12 (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: This describes the foundational setup for the protocol, specifying the cell line and genetic tool used.

units.title: Engineer lentiviral vector for inducible eCas9 and dual sgRNA
units.text: To regulate eCas9 induction, we engineered a lentiviral vector to deliver 4-hydroxytamoxifen-inducible CRE recombinase and a dual single-guide RNA (sgRNA) cassette (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: This is a key procedural step for inducing gene editing in the system.

units.title: Design dual sgRNA cassette for efficient gene editing
units.text: The dual sgRNA consists of two sgRNAs targeting the same gene, expressed under the U6 or H1 promoter. The dual gRNA is located within the 3′ long terminal repeat (LTR) and is thus transcribed by RNA polymerase II to be captured by scRNA-seq assays17.
units.rationale: This specifies the molecular design of the sgRNA construct critical for targeted editing.

units.title: Validate sgRNA efficiency using flow cytometry reporter assay
units.text: To ensure efficient generation of loss-of-function alleles, we determined the editing efficiency of each sgRNA pair using a flow cytometry-based gRNA reporter assay (Fig. 1b and Extended Data Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: This is a standardized, actionable validation step for sgRNA efficiency before use in screening.

units.title: Select efficient sgRNA pairs for 36 ASD genes
units.text: Using our reporter assay, we selected efficient sgRNA pairs for 36 ASD genes (Extended Data Fig. 1d,e and Supplementary Table 1).
units.rationale: This describes the selection of validated tools for the main screen, a critical protocol step.

units.title: Construct pooled lentiviral plasmid library
units.text: We individually cloned sgRNA pairs and pooled them equally to construct a lentiviral plasmid library (Extended Data Fig. 3a,b).
units.rationale: This is a core procedural step in creating the screening library.

units.title: Limit lentiviral integration to one per cell
units.text: To ensure that lentiviral integration frequency was limited to one per cell, we used a low infection rate of 2.5% (ref. 18) (Extended Data Fig. 3c–e).
units.rationale: This controls for experimental variability by ensuring single integration events.

units.title: Introduce unique clone barcode (UCB) for clonal tracking
units.text: To monitor the clonal complexity of the founder cells, we introduced a unique clone barcode (UCB; 1.4 × 107 combinations) for each dual sgRNA cassette to label individual lentiviral integration events (Fig. 1a and Extended Data Fig. 4a,b).
units.rationale: This is a key method for tracking clonal origins and mitigating confounding effects.

units.title: Induce eCas9 in embryoid bodies and initiate neural induction
units.text: eCas9 was induced in 5-day-old embryoid bodies, followed by neural induction.
units.rationale: This describes the timing and trigger for the genetic perturbation in the organoid protocol.

units.title: Perform scRNA-seq on 4-month-old cerebral organoids
units.text: Single-cell transcriptome profiling of cerebral organoids at 4 months revealed a large diversity of dorsal and ventral telencephalon cell populations (Fig. 1f,g and Extended Data Fig. 6a–j) (14 independent pools of organoids, 3–7 organoids each pool, 65 organoids in total, three independent batches).
units.rationale: This specifies the endpoint assay and sample processing for readout in the protocol.
